title: Barcelona boss Luis Enrique aims cheeky dig at Cristiano Ronaldo - 'I didn't see him win best player award'
text:

Luis Enrique aimed a cheeky dig at Real Madrid's Cristiano Ronaldo after the Portuguese picked up yet another individual award. 
The Barcelona boss was being asked questions about The Best FIFA Football Awards, when one reporter brought up the achievements of the 31-year-old. 
And it's fair to say the Spaniard got a little bit sassy, as the above video shows. 
He keeps his reply short and sweet and like any good manager produces the oldest cliche in the book, you know the one Arsene wenger made famous. Who knew Luis Enrique was so sassy? (Photo: Getty Images Europe) This is what it looks like, Enrique (Photo: Alexander Hassenstein - FIFA) 
"I haven't seen TV, I haven't watched TV in the last week," says Enrique, although we have the slightest suspicion he may be telling a little porky. 
He then adds: "So I haven't seen the spectacle that you're talking about." 
Simple as that really. Not a Barcelona player in sight (Photo: REUTERS) 
Ronaldo picked up the best player of the year award, seeing off tough competition in the form of Lionel Messi, who snubbed the event, and Antoine Griezmann. 
A number of other stars representing the Nou Camp giants also failed to attend the ceremony, which led to some criticism. 
But we're sure most had brilliant reasons - our favourite is of course Neymar's... what a man. Like us on Facebook
